title: Kylie Minogue, 51, stuns in a skintight blue dress as she re-enacts her steamy music video for SLOW
text:
She thrilled fans when she released the music video for her hit single Slow, back in 2003.

And on Sunday, Kylie Minogue proved she's still got it, as she re-enacted the steamy film clip.

The 51-year-old blonde was seen on set in Sydney's Coogee rolling around in a skintight blue dress, similar to the one she wore in the original clip.

She's still got it! Pop princess Kylie Minogue, 51, stunned in a skintight blue dress as she re-enacted her steamy music video for SLOW in Sydney on Sunday... 16 years after it was first released

Remember this? She thrilled fans when she released the music video for her hit single Slow, back in 2003 (pictured)

Showing off a soft golden glow, the star stunned on the day.

She wore her short blonde locks out and over her shoulders and makeup including a bright red lip.

Kylie - who is known for hits including Can't Get You Out of My Head and Spinning Around - wore black vintage-style sunglasses.

Dolled up: She wore her short blonde locks out and over her shoulders and makeup including a bright red lip

Off-duty style: While walking around on set while not filming, Kylie covered up in a white bathrobe and wore sandals

Gorgeous! The 51-year-old blonde was seen on set in Sydney's Coogee rolling around in a skintight blue dress, similar to the one she wore in the original clip

Blast from the past! In the original clip, sings and writhes around on a towel while shirtless dancers surround her (pictured)

While walking around on set while not filming, Kylie covered up in a white bathrobe and wore sandals.

In the original clip, sings and writhes around on a towel while shirtless dancers surround her.

On Sunday she was surrounded my men and women again.

It comes after Kylie was named the GQ Icon of the Year at the GQ Men of the Year Awards 2019.

The singer is loved-up with her boyfriend Paul Solomon, who is the GQ creative director, and talked to the publication after her win about her future and admitted that she 'never really plans'.

She said: 'I never really plan, there's no ﬁve, ten-year master strategy, but I always think, ''I wonder what's round the corner?'' Maybe I'll just take a peek.'

Kylie also spoke about why it took her so long to earn the credit that she deserves after four decades in the music industry.

She said: 'Tall Poppy Syndrome. I have copped that always, forever. I had to learn about that really early on.'
description: She thrilled fans when she released the music video for her hit single Slow, back in 2003.
authors: Chloe-Lee Longhetti For Daily Mail Australia
